form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: Establishing the Committee to Reduce Government Waste.

section.text: There shall be aSenatecommittee known as theCommittee to Reduce Government Waste(referred to in this resolution as thecommittee).

subsection.text: The committee shall be composed of 12 members as follows:

paragraph.text: Four members from theCommittee on Finance, 2 selected by the majority leader and 2 selected by the minority leader.
Four members from theCommittee on Appropriations, 2 selected by the majority leader and 2 selected by the minority leader.
Four members from theCommittee on the Budget, 2 selected by the majority leader and 2 selected by the minority leader.
Members shall be appointed for a period not to exceed 6 years.
No person shall continue to serve as a member of the committee after that person has ceased to be a member of the Committee from which the member was chosen.

subsection.text: Any vacancy in the committee shall not affect its powers, but shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment.
The committee shall select a Chairman and Vice Chairman from among its members.

A majority of the members of the committee shall constitute a quorum, but a lesser number of members may hold hearings. The powers conferred upon them undersection 4may be exercised by a majority vote.
The committee shall have the following duties:

subparagraph.text: research, review, and study Federal programs that are underperforming or nonessential; and
determine which Federal programs should be modified or eliminated.

paragraph.text: The committee shall develop recommendations to theSenatefor actions designed to modify or eliminate underperforming or nonessential Federal programs.
The committee shall submit to theSenate—

subparagraph.text: at least once a year, reports including—

clause.text: a detailed statement of the findings and conclusions of theCommittee; and
a list of underperforming or nonessential Federal programs; and

subparagraph.text: such legislation and administrative actions as the committee considers appropriate.

subsection.text: Any legislation submitted to theSenateby the committee shall be considered under the provisions of section 310 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974(2 U.S.C. 641).
The committee or, at its direction, any subcommittee or member of the committee, may, for the purpose of carrying out the provisions ofsection 3—

paragraph.text: sit and act, at any time, during the sessions, recesses, and adjourned periods ofCongress;
administer oaths and take testimony; and

subsection.text: The provisions ofsection 1821 of title 28, United States Code, shall apply to witnesses requested to appear at any hearing of the committee. The per diem and mileage allowances for witnesses shall be paid from funds available to pay the expenses of the committee.
The committee, or any subcommittee thereof, is authorized to make such expenditures as it deems advisable.

section.text: Except as otherwise provided by law, the committee shall have the power to appoint and fix the compensation of the Chief of Staff of the committee and such experts and clerical, stenographic, and other assistants as the committee deems advisable.
The expenses of the committee shall be paid from the contingent fund of theSenate.
